params.amount: The amount of tokens they're sent
params.recipient: The address that is sent the leftover MyShell tokens

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this. _Available since v3.1._

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call, an admin role bearer except when using {AccessControl-_setupRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params._account: The public key of the recipient
params._amount: The amount of tokens that this user is claiming
params._proof: The merkle proof of this users _account and _amount variables as a leaf within the contracts `root` variable merkle tree

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params._root: The new root of the merkle tree

params._timestamp: The new timestamp to set the Airdrop available at

LeftoverMyShellWithdrawn(address,uint256.notice: Event emitted when the leftover MyShell tokens are withdrawnOnly callable by accounts with the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE role

MerkleRootUpdated(bytes32).notice: Event emitted when the merkle root of the contract is updated

UnlockTimeUpdated(uint256).notice: Event emitted when the airdrop unlock time is updated

dropDuration().notice: the duration of the claiming period, after which excess tokens can be send back to the MyShell Treasury

myshellToken().notice: the address of the MyShell ERC20 token

redeem(address,uint256,bytes32[]).notice: The function that is called by users to claim their MyShell tokens

root().notice: the merkle root of the airdrop recipient addresses

setRoot(bytes32).notice: Allows for updating of the contracts merkle rootOnly callable by accounts with the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE role

setUnlockTime(uint256).notice: Allows for updating of the unlock time of the Airdrop to be changedOnly callable by accounts with the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE role

unlockTime().notice: the timestamp when claiming of tokens can begin

usedClaims(bytes32).notice: a way of tracking which users have claimed their tokens using their merkle proofs

withdrawLeftoverMyShell().notice: Allows for withdrawal of the excess tokens after the claim period of this contract has ended
